Package seng202.group2.controller

Class DataImporter

java.lang.Object
seng202.group2.controller.DataImporter
Direct Known Subclasses:
CSVImporter
public abstract class DataImporter
extends java.lang.Object
An abstract class providing an interface for importing crime data from a supported file type. This class has one static method used to get a DataImporter for a file, that is compatible with the supplied file type. IMPORTANT: After using a DataImporter the close() method must be called to free up any resources reserved by opening files, etc.
Author:
Connor Dunlop

  • Constructor Details

    • DataImporter

      public DataImporter​(java.io.File file)
      Sets the path to the file to import crime data from.
      Parameters:
      file - The path of the file to import crime data from.

  • Method Details

    • close

      public abstract void close() throws java.io.IOException
      Releases any resources reserved by opening files, etc. back to the operating system.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an error occurs trying to close the reserved resources.

    • getImporter

      public static DataImporter getImporter​(java.lang.String fileName) throws UnsupportedFileTypeException, java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Gets a DataImporter instance that can parse the supplied file. Uses the suffix of the file path to determine the type of file supplied, and consequently which DataImporter to use to parse the file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The path of the file from which to import crime data.
      Returns:
      An instance of a DataImporter subclass which can parse the file type determined by the suffix of the file path.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedFileTypeException - If the file suffix does not match a supported file type
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - If no file could be found with the supplied file path

    • importAllRecords

      public abstract java.util.ArrayList<CrimeRecord> importAllRecords() throws java.io.IOException
      Imports all crime records from the file to which this DataImporter is bound to.
      Returns:
      A CrimeData instance with all (valid) crime records from the file.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an error occurs when trying to parse the file.
